result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Edward Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release shall be due by 08-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

Concurrent with: concurrent with count 1 in 15CF1173 and count 3 in 15CF1173 but consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; with credit for 53 days (2-16-2015 to 2-20-2015 and 06-23-2015 to 08-10-2015) time served.

Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

charges.descr: Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Edward Pearson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (35 pages) commencing AUGUST 10, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS of incarceration concurrent with count 1 in 15CF1173 and count 3 in 15CF1173 but consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; with credit for 53 days (2-16-2015 to 2-20-2015 and 06-23-2015 to 08-10-2015) time served. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release shall be due by 08-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Anthony Edward Pearson not in court, in custody, in the bull pen.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requested a brief adjournment for reasons presented to the Court. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08-10-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

 AS TO COUNT  1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody pending sentencing. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Anthony Edward Pearson not in court, in custody, not produced.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons presented to the Court, case adjourned for plea and sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. For the reasons placed on the record the case is adjourned for projected Plea and Sentencing on 6-1-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing. For reasons placed on the record court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned for Projected Plea and Sentencing on 4-21-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
All previous terms and conditions remain.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court.  Paul Hauer for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel out ill. 
Court addresses the Defendants late appearance. Case is adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 3-27-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson not in court.  Attorney Krause for the Defense called into the court, ill. Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Ron Dague for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail Refund Packet.

02-19-2015

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-036

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
